items.label: hypothesis_stated
items.evidence: Intro: "we investigated the therapeutic effects of transplantation with BDNF modified hUC-MSCs-derived cholinergic-like neurons in AD rats in this study."

items.label: outcomes_described
items.evidence: Abstract/Methods list outcomes: "Morris water maze test, Western blotting, Immunohistochemistry, Immunofluorescence assay and TUNEL detection were performed."

items.label: patient_characteristics
items.evidence: Animals described: "Adult male Sprague–Dawley (SD) rats (250–280g)... housed at..." Group sizes: "(n=6 for each group)".

items.label: interventions_described
items.evidence: Model + treatment detailed: "1μl Aβ1-42... injected into the right hippocampus" then "1μl cell suspension... 2×105/μl... at 0.5μl/min" with coordinates.

items.label: confounders_described
items.evidence: No baseline comparability table/variables across groups; only says rats were "randomly divided into four groups" without reporting distributions of potential confounders.

items.label: main_findings_clear
items.evidence: Quantified results reported with N and comparisons (e.g., MWM: "N=6 for each group"; multiple figures report mean±SD and group differences for biomarkers).

items.label: random_variability
items.evidence: Stats section: "result were presented as the mean ± standard deviation (SD)"; multiple figure legends state "Values were given as mean±SD".

items.label: adverse_events
items.evidence: No reporting of adverse events/welfare outcomes after stereotaxic injections/transplantation; only procedural anesthesia/perfusion described.

items.label: loss_to_followup
items.evidence: States group size "n=6" but does not report attrition/mortality or whether all animals completed 8-week follow-up and MWM.

items.label: exact_p_values
items.evidence: Uses thresholds only (e.g., "P < 0.05", "P < 0.01"; figure legends use stars), no exact p-values reported.

items.label: subjects_representative
items.evidence: Rats sourced from a breeding farm ("qinglong mountain animal breeding farm") but no info on sampling/representativeness beyond species/sex/weight.

items.label: participants_representative
items.evidence: Animal study; no consent/participation process relevant. Rats were obtained from a breeding farm and assigned to groups (no non-response).

items.label: setting_representative
items.evidence: Standard preclinical setting and common assays: stereotaxic hippocampal injections, MWM, WB, IHC/IF, TUNEL (typical lab methods).

items.label: subjects_blinded
items.evidence: No statement that animals were blinded to treatment; procedures differ (cell transplantation vs none), so blinding would need to be described but isn't.

items.label: assessors_blinded
items.evidence: No mention of blinded outcome assessment for MWM scoring, Western blot quantification, or histology counting (e.g., Image-Pro Plus).

items.label: data_dredging_acknowledged
items.evidence: Outcomes/analyses pre-specified in abstract/methods (MWM, WB, IHC/IF, TUNEL, Ach kit) rather than presenting post-hoc analyses as primary.

items.label: followup_adjusted
items.evidence: Same follow-up for all: "All the rats were undergone MWM test at 8weeks after transplantation"; no variable follow-up lengths reported.

items.label: appropriate_stats
items.evidence: Methods: "Student’s t test" for 2-group comparisons and "one-way ANOVA... LSD posthoc test" for multi-group; fits continuous outcomes (latency, protein levels).

items.label: compliance_reliable
items.evidence: Intervention is single administration: stereotaxic injection of Aβ and then "1 μl cell suspension was injected"; compliance not subject-dependent.

items.label: outcomes_valid
items.evidence: Uses established measures: "Morris Water Maze test" for spatial memory; standard biomarkers via WB/IHC/IF and apoptosis via "TUNEL Apoptosis Detection Kit".

items.label: same_population
items.evidence: All rats from same source: "Adult male Sprague–Dawley (SD) rats... obtained from qinglong mountain animal breeding farm" then randomized to groups.

items.label: same_time_period
items.evidence: No recruitment dates or batching described for animals/cell prep; only procedural timing (2 weeks post Aβ; 8 weeks post transplant).

items.label: randomized
items.evidence: Explicit randomization stated: "AD rats were randomly divided into four groups (n=6 for each group)".

items.label: allocation_concealed
items.evidence: No description of allocation concealment (no sealed envelopes/central assignment); only states "randomly divided".

items.label: confounding_adjusted
items.evidence: No ITT statement or adjustment/matching described; analyses are unadjusted ANOVA/t-tests, and no handling of potential confounders is reported.

items.label: losses_accounted
items.evidence: Does not report whether any rats died/withdrew during the 8-week period; no CONSORT-style accounting of animals analyzed.

items.label: sufficient_power
items.evidence: No sample size/power calculation reported; small groups noted ("n=6 for each group"), and limitations acknowledge dose-effect not studied.

items.label: hypothesis_stated
items.evidence: Abstract: 'We investigated the performances of rs-fMRI and sMRI... for classifying... MCI-C from... MCI-NC.'

items.label: outcomes_described
items.evidence: Methods/Overall procedure: 'trained and tested a support vector machine to classify MCI-C from MCI-NC' and report accuracy/sensitivity/specificity/AUC.

items.label: patient_characteristics
items.evidence: Table 1 gives N, sex, age, EMCI/LMCI, MMSE, CDR, FAQ; Methods 2.2 details conversion windows and scores plus exclusion ('excluded...converted from AD to MCI').

items.label: interventions_described
items.evidence: Methods 2.3 describes rs-fMRI acquisition (TR/TE=3000/30ms etc.) and preprocessing; 2.3.2 FreeSurfer processing; comparison is sMRI vs rs-fMRI vs combined.

items.label: confounders_described
items.evidence: Table 1 reports baseline differences (sex, age, EMCI/LMCI, MMSE, FAQ with p-values) but no adjustment strategy for these confounders is described.

items.label: main_findings_clear
items.evidence: Table 2 reports accuracy/sensitivity/specificity/PPV/AUC for each model; Table 3 reports means±SD for key features in MCI-C vs MCI-NC with p-values.

items.label: random_variability
items.evidence: Table 1 gives age as mean±SD; Table 3 reports 'MCI-C(mean±STD)' and 'MCI-NC(mean±STD)' for selected features.

items.label: adverse_events
items.evidence: Imaging/ML observational study (rs-fMRI, sMRI) with no intervention; adverse events not expected (diagnostic prediction only).

items.label: loss_to_followup
items.evidence: Methods 2.2 defines MCI-NC as 'did not convert to AD after 36 months of follow-up' but does not report dropouts or characteristics of those lost.

items.label: exact_p_values
items.evidence: Table 1 provides exact p-values (e.g., EMCI/LMCI p=0.035; FAQ p=0.049); Table 3 reports p=1.58×10−7 etc.

items.label: subjects_representative
items.evidence: Subjects drawn from ADNI; selection notes 'all MCI-C and MCI-NC...who had rs-fMRI and sMRI data were included', but representativeness of ADNI to general MCI not established.

items.label: participants_representative
items.evidence: No participation rate or comparison of participants vs non-participants is reported; only states data were selected from ADNI.

items.label: setting_representative
items.evidence: Acquisition: '3-T Philips scanner' per ADNI protocol, but clinical setting/staff representativeness to typical care is not described.

items.label: subjects_blinded
items.evidence: No mention of blinding subjects; rs-fMRI instructions: 'Participants were instructed to rest with their eyes open'—group assignment (converter status) not blinded.

items.label: assessors_blinded
items.evidence: Automated pipelines (DPARSF/SPM/FreeSurfer) are described, but no explicit statement that analysts/labeling were blinded to MCI-C vs MCI-NC.

items.label: data_dredging_acknowledged
items.evidence: Multiple atlases, feature-selection (MRMR + SFC), and many classifier variants tested (Table 2), but paper does not label analyses as exploratory/post-hoc.

items.label: followup_adjusted
items.evidence: Methods 2.2: MCI-C converted 'after 6–36 months' while MCI-NC had 36-month stability; no analysis adjusting for variable time-to-conversion is reported.

items.label: appropriate_stats
items.evidence: Uses SVM with k-fold CV and repeated subsampling for imbalance: 'random sub-sampling... repeated 1000 times' and reports AUC/accuracy; NBS with permutation testing (n=10,000).

items.label: compliance_reliable
items.evidence: Single-session imaging exposures; rs-fMRI protocol specified ('rest with eyes open') and acquisition standardized by ADNI—non-compliance unlikely to affect classifier training materially.

items.label: outcomes_valid
items.evidence: Outcome is conversion classification based on ADNI clinical diagnosis; imaging measures extracted with established tools (DPARSF/SPM12, FreeSurfer) with cited methods and ADNI protocol.

items.label: same_population
items.evidence: Both groups are from same ADNI source: 'Data...selected from...ADNI database' and includes '18 MCI-C and 62...MCI-NC...included in this study.'

items.label: same_time_period
items.evidence: No recruitment dates or enrollment period for the included ADNI participants are provided.

items.label: randomized
items.evidence: Observational classification study with groups defined by outcome (conversion vs non-conversion); no random allocation described.

items.label: allocation_concealed
items.evidence: Non-randomised observational design; no intervention assignment to conceal.

items.label: confounding_adjusted
items.evidence: No multivariable adjustment/matching reported; analyses focus on SVM features and t-tests, while baseline differences exist (Table 1 e.g., EMCI/LMCI p=0.035).

items.label: losses_accounted
items.evidence: Study defines follow-up (MCI-NC stable 36 months) but does not report attrition numbers or how missing follow-up was handled.

items.label: sufficient_power
items.evidence: No sample size/power calculation reported; sample is small and imbalanced (18 MCI-C vs 62 MCI-NC), handled via subsampling but not powered a priori.

items.label: hypothesis_stated
items.evidence: Background: analyses 'assessed the hypothesis that variation in these three biomarker outcomes is (at least partially) genetically determined'.

items.label: outcomes_described
items.evidence: Methods: GWAS used 'log-transformed concentration of CSF NfL, CSF Ng, and CSF YKL-40 as dependent outcome variables.'

items.label: patient_characteristics
items.evidence: Table 1 reports age/sex and diagnosis counts, but no explicit inclusion/exclusion criteria are provided in the excerpt ('ascertainment procedures... described elsewhere').

items.label: interventions_described
items.evidence: Exposure/conditions are genetic variants (GWAS) with specified genotyping and imputation: 'Infinium Global Screening Array... After QC and imputation... 7,778,465 SNPs'.

items.label: confounders_described
items.evidence: Confounders listed (sex, age, diagnosis, PCs) in Methods, but distributions by diagnostic group not fully shown beyond counts in Table 1.

items.label: main_findings_clear
items.evidence: Results mainly report betas and P-values (e.g., Table 2) without providing group-wise biomarker means/SDs by genotype or diagnosis for checking analyses.

items.label: random_variability
items.evidence: Table 1 provides random variability for age (e.g., 'Mean age ± SD'), and regression outputs provide effect sizes (betas) with P-values.

items.label: adverse_events
items.evidence: Genetic association study with CSF assays; no intervention administered. Adverse events are not expected for GWAS/biomarker analysis.

items.label: loss_to_followup
items.evidence: States 'Clinical follow-up data were available for 759 individuals' but does not describe characteristics of those without follow-up.

items.label: exact_p_values
items.evidence: Exact P-values are reported throughout (e.g., 'P = 3.85E-09', 'P=.0026', Table 2 lists specific P-values).

items.label: subjects_representative
items.evidence: Discussion notes sampling not representative: 'EMIF-AD MBD dataset was not designed to be “representative” of the general population'.

items.label: participants_representative
items.evidence: No participation rate or comparison of participants vs non-participants is reported in the provided text.

items.label: setting_representative
items.evidence: Multi-center cohort: 'CSF specimens were collected... at each of the 11 EMIF-AD MBD participating sites' plus ADNI replication.

items.label: subjects_blinded
items.evidence: Subjects cannot be blinded to genotype; exposure is DNA variants. Biomarker levels measured from CSF samples independent of subject awareness.

items.label: assessors_blinded
items.evidence: Biomarkers measured by ELISA/immunoassay, but no statement that lab personnel were blinded to diagnosis/genotype.

items.label: data_dredging_acknowledged
items.evidence: Exploratory framing: 'performed the first bona fide GWAS on CSF levels...' and post-GWAS analyses described separately ('FUMA... post-GWAS analyses').

items.label: followup_adjusted
items.evidence: Primary outcomes are cross-sectional CSF biomarker levels; GWAS uses 'age at examination' and no time-to-event/follow-up modeling.

items.label: appropriate_stats
items.evidence: Methods use standard GWAS linear regression with covariates and log-transform: 'Linear regression... imputation-derived allele dosages... log-transformed concentration'.

items.label: compliance_reliable
items.evidence: No intervention requiring compliance; genotypes and CSF assays are objectively measured exposures/outcomes (ELISA/immunoassay).

items.label: outcomes_valid
items.evidence: Validated assays specified: NfL 'NF-light ELISA, Uman Diagnostics'; YKL-40 'Quantikine ELISA kit (R&D Systems)'; Ng immunoassay described.

items.label: same_population
items.evidence: All EMIF groups drawn from same EMIF-AD MBD cohort with different baseline diagnoses: 'includes... with different cognitive diagnoses at baseline (NC, MCI, AD)'.

items.label: same_time_period
items.evidence: No recruitment dates or time windows are provided for EMIF-AD MBD or ADNI in the excerpt.

items.label: randomized
items.evidence: Observational GWAS with no assignment: 'performed genome-wide association studies (GWAS) using DNA and CSF samples' (no randomization mentioned).

items.label: allocation_concealed
items.evidence: Non-randomised observational design; no intervention allocation to conceal.

items.label: confounding_adjusted
items.evidence: Regression model adjusted for confounders: 'Covariates included... sex, age at examination, diagnostic groups... and... principal components (first five)'.

items.label: losses_accounted
items.evidence: Main analyses are cross-sectional GWAS of CSF biomarkers (Table 1 Ns per biomarker); follow-up not used in primary outcomes.

items.label: sufficient_power
items.evidence: No sample size/power calculation reported; Discussion acknowledges limited power: 'samplesize... relatively modest... limiting our power to detect... small effects'.
